p: The extract was prepared following the recommendations of previous studies realized on the stem bark of this plant for phytochemical screening and medicinal potentials [ 23, 24]. Powdered leaves (300 g) of D. edulis were macerated in 3 L of distilled water for 48 h at room temperature. The supernatant was then filtered with Whatman paper no. 4 and dried in an oven at 40°C for two days. Twenty-nine grams (yield: 9.67%) of the aqueous extract was obtained and stored in an air-tight container at −20°C until use.
